data.simplified_title: Targeting DNA repair pathways in prostate cancer
data.source_system: Understanding the mechanisms in the development of mutations in cancers will assist in development of targeted therapies to overcome chemotherapy resistance. The recently discovered TMPRSS2:ERG fusion in prostate cancer is unique as dominant fusion translocations are uncommon in solid organ malignancy. Activation induced cytidine deaminase (AID) is thought to play a role. Understanding the role of AID and downstream DNA repair pathways may be a target for future therapies in cancer.
